name: notable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 important and deserving attention, because of being very good or interesting: a notable collection of rare plants Getting both sides to agree was a notable achievement. This attractive building is particularly notable for its woodland setting. Compare
renowned
famed
More examplesFewer examplesSydney Smith, a notable wit, once remarked that he never read a book before he reviewed it because it might prejudice his opinion of it.The library houses a notable collection of rare manuscripts.The renaissance was notable for the spread of learning outside the university.He was credited with making a notable contribution to the peace process."Hamlet" and "Macbeth" are among Shakespeare's most notable works.
